problem_text:
Find all finite groups with the property that the tensor square of any ordinary irreducible character is multiplicity free.
J. Saxl
answer: Such groups are shown to be soluble (L. S. Kazarin, E. I. Chankov, Sb. Math., 201, no. 5 (2010), 655–668), and abundance of examples shows that a classification of such soluble groups is not feasible.
